confession.devil_appearance: man in grey with cloven foot
confession.seduction_date: varying accounts: 2 years, 9 years, 14 years earlier
confession.seduction_context: appeared when husband was away gambling, she had no money for bread; gave her 6 gros, then had intercourse; she opened door thinking it was her husband returning
sabbat_activities: making hail to spoil hemp crop
rode on forks smeared with grease

witnesses.name: Saw Adam
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: brother of her husband Lutschen Hans

testimony.quarrel_subject: He woke at night to find her standing by his bed; he seized her, dragged her outside, struck her and threatened to kill her with an axe
testimony.threat_quote: Va ten toy ny ton mary naurez ny pourez avoir chance ny bon encontre tandis que soyez ensembles

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: unable to keep animals successfully until time of beating (about 10 years)

harms_alleged.harm_description: child found dead in cot at foot of bed
felt something fall on him and press on him at midnight

testimony.quarrel_subject: he took and ate peas from her garden with his fork
testimony.threat_quote: she would eat some of his

harms_alleged.harm_description: became very ill, excreting rounded worms which looked like peas

testimony.quarrel_subject: she and another girl were collecting herbs (queue de chatte) in Maiette's field planted with hemp; Maiette struck her

harms_alleged.harm_description: ill for 3 years, feeling as if feet were pierced, great pain

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute over finding lost bull and subsequent events

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within days of finding the bull
harms_alleged.harm_description: became swollen so that skin was four inches apart from flesh
left arm became swollen, in agony; surgeons drew off six pots of watery substance mixed with white matter like curdled milk
returned with mouth black as coal, unable to speak or stand, died 3 days later

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Arrested after orders from Sr Saubremont, commanding at Bitche, following ducal order and denunciation by Hans Melchior (executed at Murimont)

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied being a witch, claimed she had reputation but blamed 'le mauvais monde'

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Confronted with witnesses; denied most charges

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed under extreme duress

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Initially retracted confessions, then renewed them

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from Change de Nancy

timeline.subject: Lutschen Maiette
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Bitche

methods: thumbscrews (applied multiple times, broke or opened of themselves twice)
rack with triangle of wood under back

accomplices_named.name: Hans Melchior
accomplices_named.context: confessed she had been at sabbat with him

accomplices_named.name: Marguerite la Porchiere
accomplices_named.context: confessed she had been at sabbat with her; killed child of Schutz Hans together; killed three horses 'du Bergier du Rozeau' by riding on them; killed 'la mulniere de Vaustein' together

accomplices_named.name: Haffner Ottel
accomplices_named.context: wife of Emrich du Rozeau; killed child of Schutz Hans

accomplices_named.name: Odille
accomplices_named.context: killed 'la mulniere de Vaustein' with Marguerite

prior_accusations.context: denunciation that led to her arrest

notable_quotes.speaker: Lutschen Maiette (to Saw Adam's wife)
notable_quotes.french: Va ten toy ny ton mary naurez ny pourez avoir chance ny bon encontre tandis que soyez ensembles
notable_quotes.english: Go away, you and your husband will have no chance or good fortune as long as you are together
notable_quotes.context: Threat after they left her house

notable_quotes.speaker: Schutz Hans le Tireur
notable_quotes.french: par la mort il fault que je vous face brusler toute trois
notable_quotes.english: By death I must have all three of you burned
notable_quotes.context: Called out when three women appeared in his room tormenting him

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas le Tailleur (threat from Maiette)
notable_quotes.french: she would eat some of his
notable_quotes.context: After he ate peas from her garden

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe femme Philipe le Moictrier
notable_quotes.french: quelle ny son cheval ne se trouveroient devant ledit Mre Simon
notable_quotes.english: that neither she nor her horse would be found before the said Mre Simon
notable_quotes.context: Refused to lend horse for executioner to drag out dead bull

notable_quotes.speaker: Mre Simon (executioner)
notable_quotes.french: Je m'estonne que le magistrat endure vivre tant de sorcieres en ce lieu adjoustant que ladite Mayete lavoit ensorcelle
notable_quotes.english: I am astonished that the magistrate allows so many witches to live in this place, adding that the said Mayete had bewitched it
notable_quotes.context: Upon examining the dead bull and finding three black marks where witches sat

notable_quotes.speaker: Lutschen Maiette (under torture)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il nous fauldroit rendre compte des tourments que luy faisions endurer quel vouldroit que fussions tous en pareil estat
notable_quotes.english: that we would have to account for the torments we made her endure, that she would wish we were all in the same state

notable_quotes.speaker: Lutschen Maiette (confession)
notable_quotes.french: ayant toutes volontez de tout ruiner et faire touts les meschancetez quelle pouroient
notable_quotes.english: having all desire to ruin everything and do all the evil they could

relationships.evidence_text: Brother of her husband Lutschen Hans
daughter of Louys who had been shepherd
when she was neighbour of Mayete in faubourg

economic_context.details: Dispute over shared bread oven with Barbe le Moictrier; Maiette took wood from the oven. Economic hardship mentioned: Maiette claimed she had no money to buy bread when husband was away. Witness poverty mentioned: Barbe le Moictrier blamed Maiette for her misfortune and poverty.

harms_catalog.harm_description: unable to keep any animals successfully for about 10 years
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: found her standing by his bed at night, called her witch, beat her

harms_catalog.harm_description: child found dead in cot at foot of bed
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Lutschen Maiette and other witches (Marguerite la Porchiere and Haffner Ottel per confession)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: three women appeared at night tormenting him

harms_catalog.harm_description: felt something fall on him and press on him at midnight while recovering from 2-month illness
became very ill, excreting rounded worms which looked like peas
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he took and ate peas from her garden

harms_catalog.harm_description: ill for 3 years, feeling as if feet were pierced, great pain
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: she and companion were collecting herbs in Maiette's hemp field; Maiette struck her 3-4 times

harms_catalog.victim_name: bull belonging to Barbe le Moictrier
harms_catalog.harm_description: became swollen so skin was four inches apart from flesh, died next day
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: complex dispute over finding lost bull and payment

harms_catalog.harm_description: left arm became swollen, in agony; six pots of watery substance mixed with white matter like curdled milk drawn off
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: complaint about the bull; nocturnal visitation where he saw Maiette and couldn't move or speak

harms_catalog.harm_description: disappeared, returned with mouth black as coal, unable to speak or stand, died 3 days later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: quarrel over shared bread oven; witness refused to give bread to Maiette's daughter

harms_catalog.harm_description: killed by riding on them (per confession)
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Lutschen Maiette and Marguerite la Porchiere
Marguerite la Porchiere and Odille (Maiette present)

material_culture.context: Saw Adam went to get axe from behind door to kill Maiette
Maiette needed money to buy bread; dispute over bread-making in shared oven; bread at wedding
devil gave her 6 gros to buy bread
Nicolas used fork to take peas from garden
in garden, Nicolas ate them; later excreted worms that looked like peas
Barbe and companion collecting this herb in Maiette's field
shared bread oven between Maiette and Barbe le Moictrier, source of dispute
Maiette took wood from shared oven
Barbe offered teston as reward for finding bull

material_culture.object: un noeuf pot de terre et une couverte
material_culture.context: new earthen pot and cover to make drink for bull

material_culture.object: roots: Uber Wurtzel / racine de Veate
material_culture.context: bought from Colin Mercier to make drink for bull

material_culture.object: rochat de toile noir bandé d'une bande de drap rouge
material_culture.context: black linen garment with red cloth band that Maiette wore
master gave them grease to smear on forks for flying to sabbat
master gave her red liquid and other drinks to kill people
contained flowers of wheat, pears and apples given by devil for making mischief
given during torture, initially refused to swallow
Saw Adam drew sword at wedding return

spatial_references.context: primary location of trial and residence of accused
location of court, commanding officer Sr Saubremont
place where white sand was found, where Marc Poul saw Maiette at night
where Maiette's father found the lost bull
suburb where Maiette and Barbe le Moictrier were neighbors
where Barbe le Moictrier moved to escape Maiette; husband died of contagion there
location of witness Barbe femme Philipe le Moictrier
where wedding took place that Saw Adam attended with Maiette
location of miller's wife (la mulniere) who was allegedly killed
fountain where Maiette buried pot of magical items
where Marc Poul told people about seeing Maiette disappear

historical_context.military_details: Sr Saubremont commanding at Bitche in absence of M. Cazelle
weather_events: making hail to spoil hemp crop (sabbat activity)
economic_hardship_indicators: Maiette had no money to buy bread when husband was away
Barbe le Moictrier blamed Maiette for her misfortune and poverty
religious_calendar_references: Whitsun eve (when Marc Poul saw Maiette at night)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Marc Poul summoned before Receveur after reporting Maiette's supernatural disappearance; Maiette claimed her daughter was with her taking horse to pasture
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: unresolved - Receveur had to go to fields

prior_legal_disputes.description: Maiette threatened to take action against Saw Adam for calling her witch
Bastien Charpentier made complaint about bewitched bull
Bastien Charpentier made complaint about daughter's death

legal_context.redress_outcome: threatened to sue for being called witch but never pursued; officials unwilling to act if importuned too often about such insults
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: attempted to tear clothes (possibly to harm herself); spent night before execution at inn with curé

hearsay_chains.content: wife said he had seen Mayete by the bed

emotional_state_notes: pretended to cry without producing tears
called on St Nicolas for help
appealed to imperial rights (aux droits imperiaux)
looking behind her en remuant et retournant hideusement les yeux et le visage avec un tres mauvais regard (moving and turning eyes and face hideously with very bad look)
claimed shocked when taken from house that could no longer cry
refused 3 times to take oath at confrontation

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: said he was a glutton who had never done her any good; he caused her husband to beat her because she opposed his going to Adam's house
claimed she and daughter had been taking horse to pasture, had spoken to him, dispute settled before officers
said he was a ruffian who had tried to debauch her 20 years earlier and hated her for refusing him
knew she could not have said such things; claimed bull died of Naveau (natural causes); alleged settlement with husband

third_parties.name: wife of Jacques Brenon
third_parties.context: called Maiette witch several times in public without her taking action; Maiette said this had not stopped her making use of her and sending children to her house

third_parties.name: Barbe fille Claude Sibille
third_parties.context: was with Barbe fille Nicolas Francois collecting herbs in Maiette's field

third_parties.name: Nicolas Charbonnier
third_parties.context: his widow was courted by Hans Melchior

third_parties.name: widow of Nicolas Charbonnier (also called Barbe)
third_parties.context: told Maiette about Hans Melchior courting her; Maiette advised her that her husband might still have wife alive; went to curé together to call off marriage

third_parties.name: curé
third_parties.context: told not to read bans for Barbe and Hans Melchior's marriage

third_parties.name: Colin Mercier
third_parties.context: sold Maiette the roots (Uber Wurtzel) for making drink for bull

third_parties.name: widow of Dietry of the faubourg
third_parties.context: had paralysed arm after quarrel with Maiette (per witness 7)

third_parties.name: moictrier of Guetersperg
third_parties.context: Saw Adam claimed could prove Maiette threatened him

third_parties.name: daughter of Maiette
third_parties.context: was with Maiette when taking horse to pasture; received bread from Barbe le Moictrier's daughter

third_parties.name: le Bergier du Rozeau
third_parties.context: shepherd whose three horses were allegedly killed

third_parties.name: father-in-law of Saw Adam
third_parties.context: Saw Adam and Maiette lived with him 10 years earlier

third_parties.name: mother-in-law of Saw Adam
third_parties.context: rushed in when Saw Adam was beating Maiette, stopped him from killing her

third_parties.name: wife of Saw Adam
third_parties.context: lived with Maiette briefly, asked husband to find another house, left Maiette's house while he was away

third_parties.name: wife of Schutz Hans
third_parties.context: had difficulty waking in inexplicable state of terror when child was killed

third_parties.name: wife of Cleman
third_parties.context: Maiette said wife was as dear to him as her mother

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony, torture session, confessions and retractions. Rich material culture and spatial references. Complex web of community relationships and disputes. Notable for accused's vigorous defense and specific challenges to witness credibility. Confession extracted under extreme torture including thumbscrews, strappado, and rack. Trial expenses detailed: 172 francs reduced to 137 francs.
